func.title: EffectVar

param.name: index
param.desc: Index of the variable. Theoretically, any number of variables can be used. As, however, any newly accessed variable has to internally allocated first, you should only use as many variables as really necessary.

param.name: target
param.desc: Target object of the effect the of which you want to access variables. 0 for global effects.

param.name: number
param.desc: Effect number. Effect numbers are passed to effect callback functions, they are the return values of AddEffect and can be determined from an effect name via GetEffect.

func.desc: Returns a reference to an effect local variable. This reference can be used to read or write values.
func.remark: For examples and more information see the effects documentation.
